result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

State's Notice of Motion to Adjourn.

Defendant Joseph J Thomas in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Joseph J Thomas.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Joseph J Thomas in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Joseph J Thomas in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties requesting adjournment of jury trial. Court grants adjournment of jury trial. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Branch 4 down on 5-11-2022. Parties contacted to reschedule hearing. Parties agree upon new court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Motion to Adjourn

Defendant Joseph J Thomas in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph J Thomas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4. Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Joseph J Thomas in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AA C or LDC.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph J Thomas in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Joseph J Thomas in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph J Thomas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS HAS RETAINED PRIVATE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
